alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Menominee; Northern Oconto County; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 1:17PM CST until March 13 at 9:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...PROLONGED PERIOD OF ACCUMULATING SNOW... .A prolonged snow event is expected as low pressure slowly moves across the Great Lakes. Light to moderate snow is forecast to arrive late this afternoon or early evening, continue on Sunday, then come to an end from west to east Monday morning. A narrow band of heavier snow is expected to develop Sunday afternoon, roughly from northwest to east-central Wisconsin. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM CST THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Periods of snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 to 9 inches by late Monday morning. * WHERE...Calumet, Manitowoc, Winnebago, Brown, Kewaunee, Menominee, Northern Oconto County, Outagamie, Shawano, Southern Oconto County, and Waupaca Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM CST this evening to 10 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Menominee; Northern Oconto County; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Winnebago
